projectDesc.p: The Göttingen Register of Electronic Texts in Indian Languages (GRETIL) is a resource platform providing standardized machine-readable texts in Indian languages that have been contributed by various individuals and institutions.

correction.p: Apparent errors have been silently corrected.

normalization.p: GRETIL normalizes all texts contributed consistently for each language. Sanskrit texts are normalized in accordance with the scheme of the International Alphabet of Sanskrit Transliteration (IAST) in order to facilitate word search across its corpus without additional transformations.

All characters that were fully equivalent to an IAST-conformant character in the text file contributed have been made to conform to the character list below. Non-conformant characters with additional information including accents, capitalization, and whitespace have been preserved as orig elements inside choice elements with their IAST-conformant equivalent in reg elements for the creation of a plain text. These additional informations will be available only in those transformations of this file that display the original information.

quotation.p: If indicated unambiguously in the text file contributed quotation marks have been replaced with the q element and, in case a reference was provided, have been nested inside a cit with the respective reference provided in a ref element after the quote.

segmentation.p: Unnumbered div elements are used to structure the text, using the type and n attributes in accordance with the refsDecl.

interpretation.p:
Interpretive markup which is visible only in analytic transformations of this file consists of:
Highlighting in hi elements,
Corruptions in sic elements,
Remarks in note elements with the @resp attribute identifying the agency.

lg.l: kālatrayākhilajināṃśca tadīyadharmān saṅghān mahādaratayā praṇipatya cāpi /
bodhiprabheṇa kathito viśadīkaromi śiṣyottamena khalu bodhipathapradipam // Bpp_1 //
likhyate lakṣaṇaṃ teṣāṃ sphuṭaṃ pratyekabhedataḥ // Bpp_2 //
upāyena tu kenāpi kevalaṃ saṃsṛteḥ sukham /
svasyaivārthe ya īheta jñeyaḥ so puruṣo 'dhamaḥ // Bpp_3 //
ātmanirvāṇamātrārthī yo naro madhyamastu saḥ // Bpp_4 //
sarvasya yaḥ kṣayaṃ kāṅkṣeduttamaḥ puruṣastu saḥ // Bpp_5 //
bhūtvā kṛtāñjaliścāpi triścādau śaraṇaṃ vrajet // Bpp_9 //
evaṃ praṇidhicittānām utpādetu guṇāśca ye // Bpp_12 //
bodhicittāddhi yatpuṇyaṃ tacca rupi bhavedyadi // Bpp_15 //
yaścaikaḥ prāñjalirbhūtvā cittaṃ bodhāya nāmayet // Bpp_17 //
iyaṃ viśeṣyate pūjā yasyānto 'pi na vidyate /
yaḥ saṃvaravidhau dakṣaḥ svayaṃ ca saṃvare sthitaḥ // Bpp_23 //
kṛpāluḥ saṃvare śaktaḥ jñātavyaḥ sadgurustu saḥ /
tatra yatnena na prāpto guruścaitādṛśo yadi // Bpp_24 //
adhyāgre na kariṣyāmi bodhiṃ prāpsyāmi yāvatā // Bpp_28 //
nāmadheyaṃ kariṣyāmi daśadikṣu ca viśrutam // Bpp_31 //
pakṣavṛddhiṃ vinā pakṣī khe noḍaḍetuṃ yathā kṣamaḥ /
abhijñasya divārātrau yāni puṇyāni santi vai /
abhijñāyāśca rāhitye naiva janmaśateṣu ca // Bpp_37 //
ataḥ śamathasiddhayarthaṃ yatitavyaṃ punaḥ punaḥ // Bpp_39 //
prajñāpāramitāṃ yogī sopāyaṃ bhāvayet sadā // Bpp_43 //
yato bandha iti proktau praheyaṃ nobhayaṃ tataḥ // Bpp_44 //
kā prajñā ka upāyaśca śaṅkāmiti nirāsitum /
upāyasya ca prajñāyāḥ bhedaḥ samyak prakāśyate // Bpp_45 //
sarve hi kuśalāḥ dharmāḥ upāyāḥ jinabhāṣitāḥ // Bpp_46 //
śīghraṃ sa labhate bodhiṃ na nairātmyaikabhāvanāt // Bpp_47 //
ahetuteśca no tasmāt niḥsvabhāvaḥ svarupataḥ // Bpp_50 //
granthasya gauravo yasmāt atra tasmānna vistaraḥ /
nairātmyabhāvanā yā hi sā prajñāyāstu bhāvanā // Bpp_54 //
yuktayā parīkṣya tāṃ prajñāṃ so 'vikalpena bhāvayet // Bpp_55 //
vikalpaṃ durgamaṃ tīrtvāvikalpo prāpsyate kramāt // Bpp_58 //
saḥ pateddurgatau nūnaṃ siddhirnaiva kadācana // Bpp_67 //
